title: Kejriwal's 'Special Plans' To Combat Pollution In The City Include A Grand Laser Show On Diwali
text:
Kejriwal's 'Special Plans' To Combat Pollution In The City Include A Grand Laser Show On Diwali

Kejriwal's 'Special Plans' To Combat Pollution In The City Include A Grand Laser Show On Diwali

Diwali is just round the corner and concerns over the aftermath of the celebrations have already got officials thinking of plans to combat it. Year after year, Diwali festivities, which more often than not, coincide with the onset of winters, cause smog in and around Delhi-NCR.

This time, in a bid to curb the pollution, the Delhi government has shared an ambitious plan of action.

Today we have announced a 7-point Parali Pradushan Action Plan that involves

1. Odd Even

2. Pollution Masks

3. Community Diwali Laser Show

4. Environment Marshals

5. Hotspot Control

6. Dust Control

7. Tree Challenge

This is a comprehensive plan to prepare ourselves for smog. — Arvind Kejriwal (@ArvindKejriwal) September 13, 2019

In a press conference, one the first things the Chief Minister, Arvind Kejriwal announced is a redux of the odd-even rule.

Apart from that he also warned people to stop using crackers and in it's place, he said, a grand laser show will be organised on the eve of Diwali.

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal: Odd-Even vehicle scheme to be implemented from 4th to 15th November, 2019. pic.twitter.com/qVmLChGHsd — ANI (@ANI) September 13, 2019

"In Diwali, firecrackers cause massive pollution and the smoke gets trapped, as a result of which it becomes difficult to breathe in Delhi," Kejriwal said.

After the parali season ends, the Winter Action Plan will be implemented.

Other than Odd Even and community Diwali celebration, all other measures will continue throughout the winter season. — Arvind Kejriwal (@ArvindKejriwal) September 13, 2019

"I appeal to people of Delhi to not burst crackers. Delhi government will organise a laser show on the evening of Chhoti Diwali," the CM added.

Here's what people had to say about the laser show idea:

Diwali laser show is a kickass idea ! — Liberal_Mao_Zedong (@lowqualitybot1) September 13, 2019

Who in ur family runs a laser show business or maybe abt to start one?? — Aparna Gandotra (@dev_aparna) September 13, 2019

#3

@ArvindKejriwal ji pls plan a massive tree plantation scheme on the outskirts of city every month.... in the next 5-10 years we would see great control over smog and pollutants! Indeed trees are the best machines available on earth to convert CO2, CO and NOx to O2 — Anuj Dawane🇮🇳 (@AnujDawane) September 13, 2019

#4

Laser show is way better than crackers. Kaash k haryana m bhi aisa ho. — deepak (@tech_update0) September 13, 2019

Kejriwal also said that the use of water sprinklers and mechanised sweeping of roads to control dust particles will be their topmost priorities pre- and post-Diwali.

The Delhi government will start distributing N-95 category mask in large numbers from this October. N95 category mask, a disposable safety device, which covers the nose and mouth, protects the wearer from breathing in small particles in the air such as dust and mold, reports PTI.
